p: Studies show that STAT3 is one of the leading transcription factors for polarizing macrophages concerning the M2 phenotype [ 42, 43]. Phosphorylation of STAT3 via the JAK2 signaling pathway promotes the translocation of the STAT3 nucleus and activates the expression of anti-inflammatory factors related to M2 macrophages, such as IL-10 and Arg-1 [ 43, 44].
